5.26.19  1:27 pm   Have you listened to any Bach organ fugues or Buxtehude organ pieces? (e.g Chaconne in E minor)  I really love your music Bill. Strangely it is the only non-classical music that I enjoy listening to.

      I think it's because you don't use the typical I-V-VI-IV chord progression. Your harmonies seem influenced by classical and jazz.

5.26.19  10:19 am   have you ever gone through a period where you couldn't come up with anything creative?

      if so, how did you get through?

5.26.19  9:37 am   When I hear a diminished passing chord resolve up a half step, more often than not, it resolves to *minor* chord.
Meanwhile, the resolution to a major chord is a little rarer in my experience.
Do you observe the same or is that just confirmation bias on my part?

Because then my question would be: Why is the resolution to a minor chord more common when we have the diminished vii chord resolve up a half step to the major I chord, baked right into the major scale?

I'd love your opinion on this.

5.25.19  3:12 pm   Do you have any ideas on how to fuse multiple things into one big thing?

maybe

      I really wanna fuse my three main interests (art, biology and liguistics) together into one amazing thing, but unfortunately I don't know where to start!! Maybe I could draw cells dividing and have it say "mitosis" in different languages, but does that make any sense? I want it to be a huge trademark of mine, but I feel like it will eventually become very repetitive and boring for everyone to look at. Plus, I don't really think that those three things go well together. I mean, fusing art and biology is very doable, but language? How am I supposed to intergrate that into those other two things? I just don't get it.
Should I give up on the entire idea of fusing said things into one big thing , or should I start experimenting?
